div.l: Þᵗat he washolde wood in al the toıı̄un .
For euery clerk a non hulde wᵗith other
Thei seyde the man was wood ther was non other .
And euery man can laughe at that stryf
Thus swyued was the carpynteres wyf .
For his kepyng ⁊and his Ielousye
And Absolon hath kyssed hur nether eye .
And Nicolas is skalled in his toute
This tale is don god saue all the route .
Here bigynneth the ꝓprolog of the Reues tale
When folk han laughe of this nyse cas
Of Absolon ⁊and of hende Nicolas
Dyuers folk dyuersly seyde
But for the more part thei lough ⁊and pleyde
Ne at his tale say I no man him greue
But hit were only Oswold the reue
Bi cause he was of carpynteres craft
A lytel Ire in his herte laft
He bi gan to grucche ⁊and blamed him a lyte
So the I qduod he ful wel I wol quyte
Wᵗith the bleryng of a proud mylleres eye
If that me lust to speke of rybaudye
But I am olde me luste not pleye for age
Gres tyme is don my fader is for age
This white top wryeth myn olde yeres
Myn herte is also mouled as is myn heres
But if I fare as doth an open ers
That ilke fruyt is euer the lenger the wers
Till hit be roten in mullok or in stre
We olde men I drede so fare we
Till we ben roten we can not be rype
We hopen alwey while the world wol pype
